Amount of Offsets

Disclosure of the amount of offsets. This data point only needs to be completed if 305-1.2: Were offsets used to meet the GHG emissions targets? is reported as 'Yes'. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 305-1 is determined to be relevant to a material topic and 305-1.2: Were offsets used to meet the GHG emissions targets? is reported as 'Yes', a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 305: Emissions 2016, Guidance to 305-1, under Disclosure 305-1 Direct (Scope 1) GHG emissions.

Biogenic CO2 Emissions

Disclosure of biogenic CO2 emissions. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if any of the following: Disclosure 305-1 or Disclosure 305-3, are determined to be relevant to a material topic, a reason for omission must be provided for every instance in which this information cannot be reported. Further guidance can be found in GRI 305: Emissions 2016, Guidance to 305-1, under Disclosure 305-1 Direct (Scope 1) GHG emissions and Guidance to 305-3, under Disclosure 305-3 Other indirect (Scope 3) GHG emissions.

Changes to List of Material Topics Compared to Previous Reporting Period [text block]

Disclosure of changes to the list of material topics compared to the previous reporting period. Material topics represent the organization’s most significant impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including impacts on their human rights. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, a reason for omission cannot be provided for this requirement. Further guidance can be found in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021, Guidance to 3-2-b, under Disclosure 3-2 List of material topics.See also section 2.2 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 and section 1 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021 for more information on 'material topics'.

Description of Business Relationship Where Organization is Involved with Negative Impact [text block]

Disclosure of the organization's involvement with negative impacts - description of business relationships. Impact is the effect the organization has or could have on the economy, environment, and people, including on their human rights, which in turn can indicate its contribution (negative or positive) to sustainable development. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021, Guidance to 3-3-b, under Disclosure 3-3 Management of material topics.See also section 2.1 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 for more information on ‘impact’.

Description of Role of Highest Governance Body in Overseeing Organizations Due Diligence and or Processes to Identify and Manage Organizations Impacts [member]
2-12-b: Description of role of the highest governance body in overseeing the organization’s due diligence and other processes to identify and manage the organization’s impacts
Description of Role of Highest Governance Body in Overseeing Organizations Due Diligence and or Processes to Identify and Manage Organizations Impacts [text block]

Description of role of the highest governance body in overseeing the organization’s due diligence and other processes to identify and manage the organization’s impacts. Due diligence is the process to identify, prevent, mitigate, and account for how the organization addresses its actual and potential negative impacts. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. See section 2.3 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 for more information on ‘due diligence’.

Description of Scope of Workers Activities and Workplaces Covered by Occupational Health and Safety Management System [member]
403-1-b: Description of scope of workers, activities, and workplaces covered by the occupational health and safety management system
Description of Scope of Workers Activities and Workplaces Covered by Occupational Health and Safety Management System [text block]

Description of scope of workers, activities, and workplaces covered by the occupational health and safety management system. This data point only needs to be completed if an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented for employees and for workers who are not employees but whose work and/or workplace is controlled by the organization. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 403-1 is determined to be relevant to a material topic and an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented for employees and for workers who are not employees but whose work and/or workplace is controlled by the organization, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 403: Occupational Health and Safety 2018, Guidance to 403-1, under Disclosure 403-1 Occupational health and safety management system.

Distance of Site to Ecologically Sensitive Area

Disclosure of the distance of the site to ecologically sensitive area. This data point only needs to be completed if 101-5-b: Is the site in or near an ecologically sensitive area? is reported as 'Yes'. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 101-5 is determined to be relevant to a material topic and 101-5-b: Is the site in or near an ecologically sensitive area? is reported as 'Yes', a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 101: Biodiversity 2024, Guidance to 101-5-b, under Disclosure 101-5 Locations with biodiversity impacts.

Economic Value Distributed

Disclosure of the economic value distributed: operating costs, employee wages and benefits, payments to providers of capital, payments to government by country, and community investments. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 201-1 is determined to be relevant to a material topic, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 201: Economic Performance 2016, Guidance to 201-1, under Disclosure 201-1 Direct economic value generated and distributed.

Economic Value Retained

Disclosure of the economic value retained: ‘direct economic value generated’ less ‘economic value distributed’. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 201-1 is determined to be relevant to a material topic, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 201: Economic Performance 2016, Guidance to 201-1, under Disclosure 201-1 Direct economic value generated and distributed.

Emissions in Base Year

Disclosure of emissions in the base year. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if any of the following: Disclosure 305-1, Disclosure 305-2 or Disclosure 305-3, are determined to be relevant to a material topic, a reason for omission must be provided for every instance in which this information cannot be reported. Further guidance can be found in GRI 305: Emissions 2016, Guidance to 305-1, under Disclosure 305-1 Direct (Scope 1) GHG emissions, Guidance to 305-2, under Disclosure 305-2 Energy indirect (Scope 2) GHG emissions and Guidance to 305-3, under Disclosure 305-3 Other indirect (Scope 3) GHG emissions.

Explain Effectiveness of Actions Including Progress Toward Goals and Targets [text block]

List of Applicable Disclosures

List of applicable disclosures that are relevant to the organization's material topics. Material topics represent the organization’s most significant impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including impacts on their human rights. All disclosures that are assessed as relevant to the organization's material topics must be listed, including those for which a reason for omission is provided. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, a reason for omission cannot be provided for this requirement. Further guidance can be found in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021, Guidance to 3-2-a, under Disclosure 3-2 List of material topics.See also section 2.2 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 and section 1 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021 for more information on 'material topics'.

List of Likely Material Topics for Agriculture, Aquaculture and Fishing Sectors

List of the likely material topics for Agriculture Aquaculture and Fishing Sectors that are considered relevant to the organization's material topics. Material topics represent the organization’s most significant impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including impacts on their human rights.When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards and using a GRI Sector Standards, all the likely material topics listed for that Sector Standard must be assessed to determine if they are relevant to the organization's material topics. A reason must also be provided for why any of the likely material topics listed in the Sector Standard are not considered relevant to the organization's material topics. Further guidance can be found in GRI 13: Agriculture Aquaculture and Fishing Sectors 2022.See also section 2.2 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021, section 1 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021 for more information on 'material topics'.

Stakeholders and Experts Whose Views Have Informed Process of Determining Material Topics [text block]

Disclosure of stakeholders and experts whose views have informed the process of determining material topics. Stakeholder is an individual or group that has an interest that is affected or could be affected by the organization’s activities. Material topics represent the organization’s most significant impacts on the economy, environment, and people, including impacts on their human rights. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, a reason for omission cannot be provided for this requirement. Further guidance can be found in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021, Guidance to 3-1-b, under Disclosure 3-1 Process to determine material topics.See also section 2.2 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 and section 1 in GRI 3: Material Topics 2021 for more information on 'material topics' and section 2.4 in GRI 1: Foundation 2021 for more information on ‘stakeholder’.
Stakeholders and experts whose views have informed the process of determining material topics

Whether System has been Implemented Based on Recognized Risk Management and/or Management System Standards Guidelines

Disclosure of whether the system has been implemented based on recognized risk management and/or management system standards/guidelines. This data point only needs to be completed if an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented for employees and for workers who are not employees but whose work and/or workplace is controlled by the organization. When reporting in accordance with the GRI Standards, if Disclosure 403-1 is determined to be relevant to a material topic and an occupational health and safety management system has been implemented for employees and for workers who are not employees but whose work and/or workplace is controlled by the organization, a reason for omission must be provided if this information cannot be disclosed. Further guidance can be found in GRI 403: Occupational Health and Safety 2018, Guidance to 403-1, under Disclosure 403-1 Occupational health and safety management system.
